title: [features] pcli pretty print command
body:
# ðŸš€ Feature Request

### Description

Add `pretty` command in `pcli` tool

### Describe the solution you'd like

Would like to be able to pretty-print SSZ data of multiple containers type using `pcli` tool.
mainly:
- Attestation
- BeaconBlock
- BlockHeader
- Deposit
- ProposerSlashing
- SignedBeaconBlock
- SignedBlockHeader
- SignedVoluntaryExit
- BeaconState
- VoluntaryExit

Like in `zcli`:
``` sh
zcli pretty help      pretty-print SSZ data

Usage:
  zcli pretty [command]

Available Commands:
  attestation           Pretty print a Attestation, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  attestation_data      Pretty print a AttestationData, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  attester_slashing     Pretty print a AttesterSlashing, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  block                 Pretty print a BeaconBlock, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  block_body            Pretty print a BeaconBlockBody, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  block_header          Pretty print a BlockHeader, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  deposit               Pretty print a Deposit, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  deposit_data          Pretty print a DepositData, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  deposit_message       Pretty print a DepositMessage, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  eth1_data             Pretty print a Eth1Data, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  fork_data             Pretty print a ForkData, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  proposer_slashing     Pretty print a ProposerSlashing, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  signed_block          Pretty print a SignedBeaconBlock, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  signed_block_header   Pretty print a SignedBlockHeader, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  signed_voluntary_exit Pretty print a SignedVoluntaryExit, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  state                 Pretty print a BeaconState, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  state_dump            Pretty print a APIBeaconState, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
  voluntary_exit        Pretty print a VoluntaryExit, if the input path is not specified, input is read from STDIN
```
